rules: Rule1: If the findings report is submitted for publication, then it will be peer-reviewed.
Rule2: Given that Dr. Smith is assigned as the editor for the findings report, the report is copy-edited.
Rule3: Should revisions be requested for the findings report, then the publication is accepted.
Rule4: Either the field season for Site Alpha is extended, or if Dr. Smith is assigned as the editor for the findings report then revisions are requested for it.
Rule5: The museum is notified about the ceremonial mask only if its dating results have been published.
Rule6: The excavation at Site Alpha is successful provided that Site Beta has pottery shards.
Rule7: Provided that a sieve is available at Site Beta, a brush is also available there.

Rule8: Either a legal challenge is filed regarding Site Beta, or if it is not the case that (the lack of a trowel implies a lack of a sieve) leads to an excavation halt, then the permit for Site Beta is revoked.
Rule9: If a survey has been conducted at Site Alpha, then Site Alpha is in the Protected Valley region.
Rule10: A survey has been conducted at Site Alpha, or a survey has been conducted at Site Beta.
Rule11: The survey for Site Beta being rejected implies that the survey for Site Alpha is also rejected.
Rule12: If Site Alpha has the standard excavation protocol, then should a survey at Site Beta not imply it is in the Protected Valley, the survey for Site Beta is rejected.
Rule13: The dig has commenced at Site Alpha, or the dig has commenced at Site Beta.
Rule14: The dig commences at Site Beta only if Site Beta is in the Protected Valley region.
Rule15: Dr. Jones being the team lead for Site Alpha implies that Ms. Chen is the supervisor for Site Alpha.
Rule16: Dr. Jones is the team lead for Site Alpha, or Dr. Jones is the team lead for Site Beta.
Rule17: If Dr. Jones is the team lead for Site Beta, then the dig commencing at Site Alpha means Site Alpha is in the Protected Valley region.
Rule18: Ms. Chen being the supervisor for Site Alpha implies she is also the supervisor for Site Beta.
Rule19: Should Ms. Chen be the supervisor for Site Beta, then the dig commencing at Site Alpha implies Site Alpha is in the Protected Valley region.
Rule20: A permit has been applied for Site Alpha, or a permit has been applied for Site Beta.
Rule21: Site Alpha being in the Protected Valley region means a ground-penetrating radar is available there.
Rule22: Under the condition that a permit is applied for Site Beta, the condition of stable strata is met at Site Beta.
Rule23: If research from Site Alpha is submitted to the Journal of Archaeology, then a permit application for Site Alpha implies the stable strata condition is met there.
Rule24: Research from Site Beta being submitted to the Journal of Archaeology implies that research from Site Alpha is also submitted there.
Rule25: The ceremonial mask being missing implies that the findings report is not rejected for publication.
Rule26: The findings report being typeset implies it is accepted for publication.
Rule27: Site Beta being in the Protected Valley region implies excavation is not permitted there.
Rule28: The condition of stable strata being met at Site Alpha implies it is in the Protected Valley region.
Rule29: Under the condition that stable strata are met at Site Beta, Site Beta is in the Protected Valley region.
Rule30: Funding being secured for Site Alpha implies that either the stable strata condition is met at Site Alpha or it is met at Site Beta.
Rule31: Funding is secured for Site Alpha, or funding is secured for Site Beta.
Rule32: If funding is secured for Site Beta, then the stable strata condition is met at Site Alpha or at Site Beta.
Rule33: If it is not the case that having obsidian at Site Alpha implies a successful excavation there, then excavation is permitted at Site Beta.
Rule34: Provided that it is not the case that the submission of the findings report implies it is not peer-reviewed, Dr. Smith is assigned as its editor.
Rule35: If it is not true that Dr. Smith being assigned as editor implies revisions are requested, then the findings report is rejected for publication.
Rule36: Under the condition that it is false that a mask discovery at Site Beta implies no discovery at Site Alpha, carbon dating is performed on the mask.
Rule37: Whenever it is not the case that copy-editing the findings report implies it is typeset, printing of the report is scheduled.
Rule38: If it is not true that copy-editing the report implies it is typeset, then printing is not scheduled for the report.
Rule39: If it is not true that (the falsity of a mask discovery at Site Beta implying no discovery at Site Alpha) implies carbon dating was not performed, then the museum is notified about the mask.

Rule40: Under the condition that it is false that (the falsity of a mask discovery at Site Beta implying no discovery at Site Alpha) implies carbon dating was not performed, the dating results for the mask are not published.
Rule41: Provided that it is not the case that (the falsity of a trowel malfunction implying no trowel availability) implies a replacement was ordered, the replacement trowel arrives.
Rule42: If it is not true that (the falsity of a trowel malfunction implying no trowel availability) implies a replacement was ordered, then the replacement trowel does not arrive.
Rule43: Site Beta not having pottery shards implies a trowel is available at Site Beta.
Rule44: The excavation at Site Alpha not being successful implies the findings report is submitted for publication.
Rule45: Should the excavation at Site Alpha not be successful, then a ceremonial mask artifact is discovered at Site Alpha.
Rule46: Under the condition that the excavation at Site Alpha is not successful, a ceremonial mask artifact is discovered at Site Beta.
facts: Fact2: Site Alpha has the standard excavation protocol.
Fact3: Research from Site Beta has been submitted to the Journal of Archaeology.
Fact4: The ceremonial mask artifact is missing.
Fact6: It is not the case that the findings report has been accepted for publication.
Fact7: The field season for Site Alpha has not been extended.
Fact8: A brush is not available at Site Beta.
Fact9: Excavation has not been halted at Site Beta.
Fact10: The permit for Site Beta has not been revoked.
Fact11: A legal challenge has not been filed regarding Site Beta.
Fact12: A ground-penetrating radar is not available at Site Alpha.
Fact13: The survey for Site Alpha has not been rejected.
Fact14: A replacement trowel has not been ordered.

question: The excavation at Site Alpha is successful.
